column5: I am leaving tomorrow and my 12 year old son wants to take his bb gun. It is a low powered daisy gun not a pump or pellet gun. Does this present a problem at the border. If anyone knows I would appreciate an answer or if someone knows the phone number I could call and ask. We will be crossing at fort frances. thanks eric macdonald

Bringing any kind of gun through the border is not a good idea. Bring the kid a sling shot, he'll learn more from it. Take him fishing, have him clean camp, teach him poker and let him win $5. The BB gun won't even be on his mind.... Travel safe, tight lines.
Unless you want to take the chance of a several hour delay, I'd leave it at home. That's all you need, give a border agent a reason to completely search your vehicle.
As soon as you cross at Fort Frances, go to the Walmart. They have cheap bb guns for sale. Beats trying to cross the border and going thru what you may go thru. Brad
Yeah, and then leave it at camp. I'd be even more worried coming back to the states with one. Can you say Homeland Security?
